text: schools starting to open around the
country and with that comes a
controversy it's not test scores and
it's not classroom size it's over this a
glass of milk kids are drinking more
soda than milk according to the USDA
this is true in schools too and school
nutritionists are concerned that without
milk consumption kids aren't getting the
nutrients they need so they started
serving chocolate milk strawberry milk
milk with added sugars I raised my hand
for chocolate milk because it's a
healthy choice for my kids last year the
dairy industry started a campaign
supporting chocolate milk now seventy
percent of the kids drink more chocolate
milk and flavored milks and any other
kind kids who drink chocolate milk every
day in school are getting 22 244 more
grams of sugar than if they just drink
plain milk once or twice a day schools
that want to get federal reimbursement
for lunch have to offer milk the
question is whether adding sugars to
milk is really worth it so the pressure
is on between school nutrition
Association that wants chocolate milk in
schools and parents who are trying to
make school lunch healthier at stake is
millions of dollars in milk sales and of
course children's nutrition
